text.0: the pleasant priest is come into the synod true skilled in sacrifice most wise ordainer.
text.1: agni the son of strength whose car is lightning whose hair is flame hath shown on earth his lustre.
text.2: to thee i offer reverent speech accept it to thee who markest it victorious faithful.
text.3: bring thou who knowest those who know and seat thee amid the sacred grass for help o holy.
text.4: the two who show their vigour night and morning by the winds paths shall haste to thee o agni.
text.5: when men adorn the ancient with oblations these seek as on two chariotseats the dwelling.
text.6: to thee strong agni varuṇa and mitra and all the maruts sang a song of triumph.
text.7: what time unto the peoples lands thou camest spreading them as the sun of men with lustre.
text.8: approaching with raised hands and adoration we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing.
text.9: worship the gods with most devoted spirit a priest with no unfriendly thought o agni.
text.10: for son of strength from thee come many succours and powers abundant that a god possesses.
text.11: agni to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches real to be told in thousands.
text.12: whatever god in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee strong wise of purpose.
text.13: be thou the friend of each good chariots master all this enjoy thou here immortal agni.
